60908

attributes.Title: Ideas That Change the World
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Honors College
201
UMass Amherst
In this seminar, students will examine texts and works of art that have profoundly shaped the world we live in. The course is divided into four units: Models of Inquiry; the Impact of Science and Technology; Social Philosophy and Civic Engagement; and Art in the World. The course is supplemented with several plenary lectures by distinguished honors faculty speakers.
This course is open to Commonwealth Honors College students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Intens Intermd Classical Greek
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Greek
246
UMass Amherst
Continuation of GREEK 126. Description and analysis of the grammatical system of Attic Greek of the 5th century B.C. Selected readings from ancient Greek authors with background on Greek society and culture of the 5th century B.C. Prerequisite: GREEK 126.
Pre Req: GREEK 126
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Intensive Elem Classical Greek
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Greek
126
UMass Amherst
Description and analysis of the grammatical system of Attic Greek of the 5th century B.C.  Emphasis on the mastery of the grammatical system and the development of reading skills, with background on Attic society and culture of the 5th century B.C.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Euripides
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Greek
460
UMass Amherst
We will read at least one entire work of Euripides (e.g. the "Hippolytus") in the original Greek, emphasizing large quantities of prepared reading as well as sight translation and discussion of literary and cultural topics.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Classical Greek Poetry: Homer
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Greek
310
UMass Amherst
Survey of vocabulary, grammatical structure, literary formulae, and dialectical variation in Attic Greek. Historical background from the Bronze and Archaic periods. Readings from Homer's Iliad and Odyssey. Prerequisite: GREEK 242 or equivalent.  (Gen.Ed. AL)
Pre Req: GREEK 246
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

Fall
2015
Greek
320

60900

attributes.Title: Evaluating Greek Art
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art History
302
UMass Amherst
The origins, unfolding, and flowering of Greek sculpture, architecture, and painting from approximately 900 to 100 B.C. Readings from ancient literature provide essential historical and cultural background. Particular attention paid to the powerful magic of early Greek images and to issues and controversies surrounding Greek art as it is presented to the American public.
Prerequisites: ART-HIST 100 or 115
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
69730
69728

attributes.Title: Lucian
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Greek
475
UMass Amherst
We will read at least one entire work of Lucian (e.g. the "True Histories") in the original Greek, emphasizing large quantities of prepared reading as well as sight-transition. Prerequisite: Two third-year courses (or their equivalents) in ancient Greek are recommended but not required.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
68863
Requisite: We will read at least one entire work of Lucian (e.g. the "True Histories") in the original Greek, emphasizing large quantities of prepared reading as well as sight-transition. Prerequisite: Two third-year courses (or their equivalents) in ancient Greek are recommended but not required.

attributes.Title: S-I Greek I
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Five Coll Ctr: World Languages
111A
UMass Amherst
Greek I is the first part of a four-part elementary course sequence in Greek. The course is offered through the Five College Supervised Independent Language Program. The independent study format includes small group conversation sessions and an evaluation by an outside evaluator. Students studying Greek develop speaking and listening skills needed for study abroad in Greece and to support course work in European Studies.
Students must apply to add this course at www.fivecolleges.edu/fclang.
For info email: fclang@fivecolleges.edu or call 413-542-5264.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
67089

attributes.Title: Greek History
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Greek
452
UMass Amherst
Selections from Greek historians: Herodotus, Thucydides, Xenophon, Polybios, etc. Emphasis on the evolution of historiography in the ancient world. Prerequisite: 300-level course in Greek or equivalent.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
18153
Requisite: Selections from Greek historians: Herodotus, Thucydides, Xenophon, Polybios, etc. Emphasis on the evolution of historiography in the ancient world. Prerequisite: 300-level course in Greek or equivalent.
